args:
This is the tale of the Halidom's blacksmith
sisters: Ramona, Renee, and Rena. As the
prince readies for war with the Empire, he pays
a visit to their workshop. Indignant over the
Empire's atrocities, they accept his request
for aid and move to the Halidom.
(I can overcome any limitation so long\nas my sisters are at my side!)
Arise, O flame! Burn hot and hotter still!\nBurn with the fire of a thousand suns!
This is the story of how the Halidom's hardworking\nblacksmith sisters first met the prince.
Hoping to locate an exceptional blacksmith to\nshore up the military might of the Halidom,\nthe prince visited an old associate of Ranzal's.
So we hang a right...then a left...aaand...\nboom! There's ol' Mr. Bear himself.
I've never seen a workshop with a\ngiant bear statue at the front before.

Yeah, my man Regis is a bit of an oddball,
but there ain't a better smith around.
He kicked all kinds'a butt durin' the last
Golden Anvil competition.
Er, the Golden Anvil? What's that?

It's a big ol' competition held by the
blacksmith's guild. Folks from all over
submit their best weapons, then the guild
picks the one it thinks is a masterwork.
Ol' Regis took home the top prize last time\nwithout breakin' a sweat. If we swing his\nsteel, the Empire don't stand a chance!
If he's half the man you claim he is,\nI can't wait to meet him.
Knock knock! Where ya at, Regis?!
Ho there, friend! What can I do you for?\nNeed a new weapon forged?\nMaybe repairs on an old one?
No matter the job what needs doin',\nwe'll get 'er done right!
You must be Regis's daughter!\nIt's, uh...Ramona, yeah?
In the flesh. I take it you know Dad?
Yeah, he did me a solid or three back in\nthe day. Where is the old fart, anyway?!
Don't sweat it—ya weren't but knee-high\nto a grasshopper back then, so ain't no\nsurprise ya don't remember me.
No, that's not what I meant.\nDad is... He's...
Heeeeey, is that a customer? Welcome!
Bwaa ha ha! Well, if it ain't little Renee!\nLook how big ya went and got, squirt!
Wait, you know my name? Then this...
No, Renee. These are friends of Dad.
Wait, Dad's friends are coming here\nand asking for me by NAME?!\nBEST. DAY. EVEEEEER!
This means I've finally reached his level\nof blacksmith skill—or maybe even that\nI've EXCEEDED it!
What ARE you going on about, Renee?\n...Oh, goodness! I didn't know that we\nhad customers in the shop!
Guess what, Rena? These guys\nare SPECIFICALLY asking for me!
No they ain't, ya dope—they're askin' for\nDAD! They don't know what happened!
You two ARE aware that we have\ncustomers in the store, yes?
So let's maybe use our inside voices,\nmmm?
Ooof. That scoldin' sounded gentle,\nbut I felt it all the way over here.
Right then! Now that we have some quiet,\nhow might we help you gentlemen?
Well, we were hoping that Regis might\nbe willing to craft some weapons for us.
Hey, where IS Regis, anyway?\nHidin' in the back?
He got sick a little while ago. We tried\neverything, but... Well, in the end,\nthere was nothing anyone could do.
Damn. I'm sorry as hell to hear that.\nEr, but does that mean the workshop...?
Oh, the workshop's fine. Dad passed his\nskills down to us, so we're more than\ncapable of meetin' your weaponry needs.
Well, this ain't quite what I had in mind\nwhen we came down here. How ya wanna\nhandle it, {player_name}?
Let's have them craft a sword for us.\nIf we like the work, we'll go from there.
I was hopin' you'd say somethin' like that!\nWe're eager to show Dad's old customers\nthat his skills ain't died out with him.
Bwa ha ha! Kid, I like yer moxie.\nGive us the best sword ya got!
Mmm... We're still running a little cool.
It's pretty impressive how precisely she\ncan control the temperature of a flame.
Yeah, she's got a real knack for fire mana.\nHer old man was the same—it's how he\nfirst made his name in the smithin' biz.
Looks like he made sure to pass all them\nabilities and techniques down to his kids.
We're prepped and ready whenever\nyou are, Sis!
So one of them holds the weapon in place\nwhile the other swings the hammer?
It's smart. None of 'em are as big as\nol' Regis was, so this lets 'em really\nput some muscle into it.
I wasn't sure how she'd swing a hammer\nwith them spindly little arms, but looks\nlike they got a system all worked out.
Hee hee! Not a crack in sight! I really AM\na super-genius when it comes to cooling.\nOkay, Rena, you're up.
Okay, steel! Time to drink your mana!

While they put on the final touches—
sharpenin' and polishin' and whatnot—
they also pump the weapon full'a mana.
That was a Regis special, too.
Then we wipe it clean aaaand...done!
Okay, gents, here you go:\nOne perfect sword, as requested.
Well, it's incredible. I don't have another\nword for it. The balance is just sublime.
Yeah, we put a lot of thought into that\naspect. But you like the rest of it too?
Bwaaa ha ha ha! You gals are every bit\nthe pros your dad was, I tell ya what.
With them outfittin' us, we'll wipe\nthe floor with the Empire!
Wait, hold on. You guys are fightin'\nthe Empire? The DYRENELL Empire?
Um, yeah. We are. Here's the story...
The prince explains the situation and\nhis reasoning to the blacksmithing trio...
...Huh. So now you got the Empire\nhot on your heels, eh?
I dunno, guys. What do you think?\nI mean, this prince and his huge buddy\ndon't seem like BAD guys or whatever...
But if we agree to help him, the Empire\nis totally gonna come after our shop.

My sister makes a fair point, Prince.
While we all support your mission
in theory, we have to think of our
own future and safety as well.
I understand—and I won't force you to\ndo anything you aren't comfortable with.

But if you DO want to work with us,
I've been wanting to build a smithy
inside our castle for some time now.
Perhaps that could work for both of us.
Wait. You'd BUILD us a smithy?
Of course. I want to protect those who lend\ntheir skills to our cause.
In that case, we accept! Hell, all three\nof us are tired of turnin' blind eyes to\nthe crap the Empire pulls around here.
I'd love to see our weapons used to\nbring about peace instead of war.
PLUS, being the official blacksmith of a\ncastle is like earning a giant promotion!
But what will we do with THIS shop?\nIt belonged to our father, so we can't\nvery well just let it rot into oblivion.
Well, why don't we pack it up\nand move it to the Halidom?
A fine idea! Oh, and I assume we\ncan take Arctos along as well?
Hee hee! No, silly! Arctos is our bear!\n...That big monument in the front?
Our father named him and was very\nprotective of him. Beats me why though.
Well, far be it from me to abandon Arctos.\nDaughters and bears alike are all welcome\nin our castle!
